description: The MailChimp Package can be used to build real time application based on the MailChimp platform.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailChimp.

args.name: fields
args.info: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

args.name: excludeFields
args.info: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailChimp.

args.info: The unique id for the Automation workflow.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailChimp.

args.name: type
args.info: There are four types of campaigns you can create in MailChimp. A/B Split campaigns have been deprecated and variate campaigns should be used instead.

args.name: recipientsListId
args.info: The unique list id.

args.name: subjectLine
args.info: The subject line for the campaign.

args.name: title
args.info: The title of the campaign.

args.name: fromName
args.info: The ‘from’ name on the campaign (not an email address).

args.name: replyTo
args.info: The reply-to email address for the campaign.

args.name: useConversation
args.info: The reply-to email address for the campaign.

args.name: toName
args.info: The campaign’s custom ‘To’ name.

args.name: folderId
args.info: If the campaign is listed in a folder, the id for that folder.

args.name: authenticate
args.info: Whether MailChimp authenticated the campaign. Defaults to true.

args.name: autoFooter
args.info: Automatically append MailChimp’s default footer to the campaign.

args.name: inlineCss
args.info: Automatically inline the CSS included with the campaign content.

args.name: autoTweet
args.info: Automatically tweet a link to the campaign archive page when the campaign is sent.

args.name: autoFbPost
args.info: An comma separated string of Facebook page ids to auto-post to.

args.name: fbComments
args.info: Allows Facebook comments on the campaign (also force-enables the Campaign Archive toolbar). Defaults to `true`.

args.name: variateSettingsWinnerCriteria
args.info: The combination that performs the best. This may be determined automatically by click rate, open rate, or total revenue—or you may choose manually based on the reporting data you find the most valuable. For Multivariate Campaigns testing send_time, winner_critera is ignored. For Multivariate Campaigns with ‘manual’ as the winner_citeria, the winner must be chosen in the MailChimp web application. Possible Values: `opens`, `clicks`, `manual`, `total_revenue`

args.name: variateSettingsWaitTime
args.info: The number of minutes to wait before choosing the winning campaign. The value of wait_time must be greater than 0 and in whole hours, specified in minutes.

args.name: variateSettingsTestSize
args.info: The percentage of recipients to send the test combinations to, must be a value between 10 and 100.

args.name: variateSettingsSubjectLines
args.info: The possible subject lines to test. If no subject lines are provided, settings.subject_line will be used.

args.name: variateSettingsSendTimes
args.info: The possible send times to test. The times provided should be in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. If send_times are provided to test, the test_size will be set to 100% and winner_criteria will be ignored.

args.name: variateSettingsFromNames
args.info: The possible from names. The number of from_names provided must match the number of reply_to_addresses. If no from_names are provided, settings.from_name will be used.

args.name: replyToAddresses
args.info: The possible reply-to addresses. The number of reply_to_addresses provided must match the number of from_names. If no reply_to_addresses are provided, settings.reply_to will be used.

args.name: trackingOpens
args.info: Whether to track opens. Defaults to true. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

args.name: trackingHtmlClicks
args.info: Whether to track clicks in the HTML version of the campaign. Defaults to true. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

args.name: trackingTextClicks
args.info: Whether to track clicks in the plain-text version of the campaign. Defaults to true. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

args.name: trackingGoalTracking
args.info: Whether to enable Goal tracking.

args.name: trackingEcomm360
args.info: Whether to enable eCommerce360 tracking.

args.name: trackingGoogleAnalytics
args.info: The custom slug for Google Analytics tracking (max of 50 bytes).

args.name: trackingClicktale
args.info: The custom slug for ClickTale tracking (max of 50 bytes).

args.name: trackingSalesforceCampaign
args.info: Create a campaign in a connected Salesforce account.

args.name: trackingSalesforceNotes
args.info: Update contact notes for a campaign based on subscriber email addresses.

args.name: trackingHighriseCampaign
args.info: Create a campaign in a connected Highrise account.

args.name: trackingHighriseNotes
args.info: Update contact notes for a campaign based on subscriber email addresses.

args.name: trackingCapsuleNotes
args.info: Update contact notes for a campaign based on subscriber email addresses.

args.name: rssOptsFeedUrl
args.info: The URL for the RSS feed.

args.name: rssOptsFrequency
args.info: The frequency of the RSS Campaign.

args.name: rssOptsScheduleHour
args.info: The hour to send the campaign in local time. Acceptable hours are 0-23. For example, ‘4’ would be 4am in your account’s default time zone.

args.name: rssOptsScheduleDailySendSunday
args.info: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Sundays.

args.name: rssOptsScheduleDailySendMonday
args.info: TSends the daily RSS Campaign on Mondays.

args.name: rssOptsScheduleDailySendTuesday
args.info: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Tuesdays.

args.name: rssOptsScheduleDailySendWednesday
args.info: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Wednesdays.

args.name: rssOptsScheduleDailySendThursday
args.info: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Thursdays.

args.name: rssOptsScheduleDailySendFriday
args.info: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Fridays.

args.name: rssOptsScheduleDailySendSaturday
args.info: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Saturdays.

args.name: rssOptsScheduleWeeklySendDay
args.info: The day of the week to send a weekly RSS Campaign.

args.name: rssOptsScheduleMonthlySendDate
args.info: The day of the month to send a monthly RSS Campaign. Acceptable days are 0-31, where ‘0’ is always the last day of a month. Months with fewer than the selected number of days will not have an RSS campaign sent out that day. For example, RSS Campaigns set to send on the 30th will not go out in February.

args.name: rssOptsLastSent
args.info: The date the campaign was last sent.

args.name: rssOptsConstrainRssImg
args.info: Whether to add CSS to images in the RSS feed to constrain their width in campaigns.

args.name: socialCardImageUrl
args.info: The url for the header image for the card.

args.name: socialCardDescription
args.info: A short summary of the campaign to display.

args.name: socialCardTitle
args.info: The title for the card. Typically the subject line of the campaign.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailChimp.

args.name: type
args.info: The campaign type.

args.name: status
args.info: The status of the campaign.

args.name: beforeSendTime
args.info: Restrict the response to campaigns sent before the set time. We recommend ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

args.name: sinceSendTime
args.info: Restrict the response to campaigns sent after the set time. We recommend ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

args.name: beforeCreateTime
args.info: Restrict the response to campaigns created before the set time. We recommend ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

args.name: sinceCreateTime
args.info: Restrict the response to campaigns created after the set time. We recommend ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

args.info: The unique id for the list.

args.name: campaignId
args.info: The unique id for the campaign.

args.name: scheduleTime
args.info: The date and time in UTC to schedule the campaign for delivery. Campaigns may only be scheduled to send on the quarter-hour (:00, :15, :30, :45).

args.name: timewarp
args.info: Choose whether the campaign should use Timewarp when sending. Campaigns scheduled with Timewarp are localized based on the recipients’ time zones. For example, a Timewarp campaign with a schedule_time of 13:00 will be sent to each recipient at 1:00pm in their local time. Cannot be set to true for campaigns using Batch Delivery.

args.name: batchDeliveryBatchDelay
args.info: The delay, in minutes, between batches.

args.name: batchDeliveryBatchCount
args.info: The number of batches for the campaign send.

args.name: fromEmail
args.info: A label representing the email of the sender of this message

args.name: subject
args.info: The subject of this message

args.name: message
args.info: The plain-text content of the message

args.name: read
args.info: Whether this message has been marked as read

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailChimp.

args.name: conversationId
args.info: The unique id for the campaign.

args.name: isRead
args.info: Whether a conversation message has been marked as read.

args.name: beforeTimestamp
args.info: Restrict the response to messages created before the set time. We recommend ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

args.name: sinceTimestamp
args.info: Restrict the response to messages created after the set time. We recommend ISO 8601 time format: 2015-10-21T15:41:36+00:00.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the list.

args.name: contactCompany
args.info: The company name for the list.

args.name: contactAddress1
args.info: The street address for the list contact.

args.name: contactAddress2
args.info: The street address for the list contact.

args.name: contactCity
args.info: The city for the list contact.

args.name: contactState
args.info: The state for the list contact.

args.name: contactZip
args.info: The postal or zip code for the list contact.

args.name: contactCountry
args.info: A two-character ISO3166 country code. Defaults to US if invalid.

args.name: contactPhone
args.info: The phone number for the list contact.

args.name: permissionReminder
args.info: The permission reminder for the list.

args.name: useArchiveBar
args.info: Whether campaigns for this list use the Archive Bar in archives by default.

args.name: campaignDefaultsFromName
args.info: The default from name for campaigns sent to this list.

args.name: campaignDefaultsFromEmail
args.info: The default from email for campaigns sent to this list.

args.name: campaignDefaultsSubject
args.info: The default subject line for campaigns sent to this list.

args.name: campaignDefaultsLanguage
args.info: The default language for this lists’s forms.

args.name: notifyOnSubscribe
args.info: The email address to send subscribe notifications to.

args.name: notifyOnUnsubscribe
args.info: The email address to send unsubscribe notifications to.

args.name: emailTypeOption
args.info: Whether the list supports multiple formats for emails. When set to true, subscribers can choose whether they want to receive HTML or plain-text emails. When set to false, subscribers will receive HTML emails, with a plain-text alternative backup.

args.name: visibility
args.info: Whether this list is public or private.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from MailChimp.

args.name: listId
args.info: The unique id for the list.

args.info: The api key obtained from MailChimp.

args.name: beforeDateCreated
args.info: Restrict response to lists created before the set date.

args.name: sinceDateCreated
args.info: Restrict results to lists created after the set date.

args.name: beforeCampaignLastSent
args.info: Restrict results to lists created before the last campaign send date.

args.name: sinceCampaignLastSent
args.info: Restrict results to lists created after the last campaign send date.

args.name: email
args.info: Restrict results to lists that include a specific subscriber’s email address.
